required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Alternative Schedule Study For VLA15, a Vaccine Candidate Against Lyme Borreliosis
clinical_study.official_title: Alternative Schedule Study For VLA15, A Multivalent Recombinant OspA (Outer Surface Protein A) Based Vaccine Candidate Against Lyme Borreliosis, In Healthy Adults Aged 18 To 65 Years - A Randomized, Controlled, Observer-Blind Phase 2 Study

brief_summary.textblock:
A total of 250 subjects will be randomized 2:2:1 into three treatment groups to receive either VLA15 with Alum (two different dose levels) or Placebo. Vaccinations will be administered as intramuscular injections on Day 1, Day 57 and Day 180.
Study duration per subject will be a maximum of 19 months. Overall study Duration is estimated to be 21 months.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a randomized, observer-blind (subject, Sponsor and investigator/site staff involved in Clinical Evaluation of subjects are blinded), Placebo controlled, multicenter Phase 2 study.
A total of 250 healthy subjects,aged 18 to 65 years, will be randomized 2:2:1 to receive either VLA15 with Alum (two different dose levels) or Placebo. Vaccinations will be administered as intramuscular injections on Day 1 (Month 0), Day 57 (Month 2) and Day 180 (Month 6).

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: GMTs for IgG against each OspA (Outer Surface Protein A) serotype
primary_outcome.description: GMTs (Geometric Mean Titers) for IgG (Immunoglobulin G) against each OspA (Outer Surface Protein A) serotype ST1 to ST6, determined by ELISA (Enzyme-Linked Immunosorbent Assay) at Day 208 (Month 7)

secondary_outcome.measure: GMTs for IgG against each OspA serotype
secondary_outcome.description: GMTs (Geometric Mean Titers) for IgG (Immunoglobulin G) against each OspA (Outer Surface Protein A) serotype ST1 to ST6, determined by ELISA (Enzyme-Linked Immunosorbent Assay), at Day 1 (Month 0), 57 (Month 2), 85 (Month 3), 180 (Month 6), 365 (Month 12) and 545 (Month 18)

secondary_outcome.measure: SCRs for each OspA serotype specific IgG
secondary_outcome.description: SCR (Seroconversion Rate) for each OspA (Outer Surface Protein A) serotype specific IgG (Immunoglobulin G) ST1 to ST6, determined by ELISA (Enzyme-Linked Immunosorbent Assay), at Day 29 (Month 1), 57 (Month 2), 85 (Month 3), 180 (Month 6), 208 (Month 7), 365 (Month 12) and 545 (Month 18)

secondary_outcome.measure: GMFR as compared to baseline for IgG against each OspA serotype
secondary_outcome.description: GMTs (Geometric Mean Fold Rise) as compared to baseline for IgG (Immunoglobulin G) against each OspA (Outer Surface Protein A) serotype ST1 to ST6, determined by ELISA (Enzyme-Linked Immunosorbent Assay), at Day 29 (Month 1), 57 (Month 2), 85 (Month 3), 180 (Month 6), 208 (Month 7), 365 (Month 12) and 545 (Month 18)

secondary_outcome.measure: GMTs, SCRs and GMFRs for IgG against each OspA serotpye stratified by age group
secondary_outcome.description: GMTs (Geometric Mean Titers), SCR (Seroconversion Rate) and GMTs (Geometric Mean Fold Rise) for IgG (Immunoglobulin G) against each OspA (Outer Surface Protein A) serotype ST1 to ST6, determined by ELISA (Enzyme-Linked Immunosorbent Assay), at Day 1 (Month 0), 29 (Month 1), 57 (Month 2), 85 (Month 3), 180 (Month 6), 208 (Month 7), 365 (Month 12) and 545 (Month 18) stratified by age group
Frequency of SAEs (Serious Adverse Events) during the entire study
Frequency of related SAEs (Serious Adverse Events) during the entire study
Frequency of AESIs (Adverse Event of Special Interest) during the entire study
Frequency of related AESIs (Adverse Event of Special Interest) during the entire study
Frequency of unsolicited AEs (Adverse Events) during the entire study
Frequency of related unsolicited AEs (Adverse Events) during the entire study

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency of solicited local and solicited systemic AEs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to day 7 after each vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: Frequency of solicited local and solicited systemic AEs (Adverse Events) within 7 days after each and after any vaccination

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency of SAEs, AESIs, solicited and unsolicited AEs stratified by age group
secondary_outcome.description: Frequency of SAEs (Serious Adverse Events), AESIs (Adverse Event of Special Interest), solicited and unsolicited AEs during the entire study stratified by age group

arm_group.description: VLA15 with Alum lower selected Dose
VLA15 with Alum higher selected Dose

intervention.description: a multivalent recombinant Outer Surface Protein A (OspA) based vaccine candidate
